defs.docs:
A pure [Rust](https://www.rust-lang.org)
 [Modbus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modbus) library
 based on [tokio](https://tokio.rs).

attributes.value: / To avoid confusions with the tokio terminology the master is called *client*
/ and the slave is called *server* in this library.
/ If you like to use Modbus TCP only:
/ If you like to use Modbus RTU only:
/ If you like to build a TCP server:
/ pub async fn main() -> Result<(), Box<dyn std::error::Error>> {
/ # //FIXME: Run doc tests with `--features sync` to fix failure
/ pub fn main() -> Result<(), Box<dyn std::error::Error>> {
/ pub async fn main() -> Result<(), Box<dyn std::error::Error>> {
/ # //FIXME: Run doc tests with `--features sync` to fix failure
/ pub fn main() -> Result<(), Box<dyn std::error::Error>> {
/ More examples can be found in the [examples](https://github.com/slowtec/tokio-modbus/tree/master/examples) folder.
/ - [MODBUS over serial line specification and implementation guide v1.02 (PDF)](http://modbus.org/docs/Modbus_over_serial_line_V1_02.pdf)
/ - [MODBUS Messaging on TCP/IP Implementation Guide v1.0b (PDF)](http://modbus.org/docs/Modbus_Messaging_Implementation_Guide_V1_0b.pdf)

defs.name: connect
defs.value:
pub async fn connect<T>(T) -> /*impl Trait*/ where T: AsyncRead + AsyncWrite +
Debug + Unpin + Send + 'static
defs.docs:
Connect to no particular Modbus slave device for sending
 broadcast messages.

attributes.value: / Connect to no particular Modbus slave device for sending

defs.name: connect_slave
defs.value:
pub async fn connect_slave<T>(T, Slave) -> /*impl Trait*/ where T: AsyncRead +
AsyncWrite + Debug + Unpin + Send + 'static
defs.docs: Connect to any kind of Modbus slave device.

attributes.value: / Connect to any kind of Modbus slave device.

defs.name: Client
defs.docs: A transport independent asynchronous client trait.

defs.name: call
defs.value:
pub fn call<'life0, 'async_trait>(&'life0 mut Self, Request)
->
    ::core::pin::Pin<Box<::core::future::Future<Output =
                         Result<Response, Error>> + ::core::marker::Send +
                         'async_trait>> where 'life0:'async_trait,
Self: 'async_trait

defs.name: Slave
defs.docs: A single byte for addressing Modbus slave devices.

attributes.value: / A single byte for addressing Modbus slave devices.

defs.name: broadcast
defs.docs:
The special address for sending a broadcast message to all
 connected Modbus slave devices at once. Broadcast messages
 are one-way and sent from the master to all slaves, i.e.
 a request without a response.

attributes.value: / The special address for sending a broadcast message to all
/ connected Modbus slave devices at once. Broadcast messages
/ are one-way and sent from the master to all slaves, i.e.
/ Some devices may use a custom id from the reserved range

defs.name: min_device
defs.docs: The minimum address of a single Modbus slave device.

attributes.value: / The minimum address of a single Modbus slave device.

defs.name: max_device
defs.docs: The maximum address of a single Modbus slave device.

attributes.value: / The maximum address of a single Modbus slave device.

defs.name: tcp_device
defs.docs:
The reserved address for sending a message to a directly
 connected Modbus TCP device, i.e. if not forwarded through
 a TCP/RTU gateway according to the unit identifier.

attributes.value: / The reserved address for sending a message to a directly
/ connected Modbus TCP device, i.e. if not forwarded through
/ a TCP/RTU gateway according to the unit identifier.
/ "On TCP/IP, the MODBUS server is addressed using its IP address; therefore,
/ the MODBUS Unit Identifier is useless. The value 0xFF has to be used."

defs.name: SlaveContext
defs.docs: Stateful management of the currently active device.

attributes.value: / Stateful management of the currently active device.
/ RTU devices are addressed by their assigned *slave id*.
/ TCP devices are either addressed directly (= implicitly) by using the
/ through an TCP/RTU gateway by setting the *unit id* to the desired
/ The names *slave id* and *unit id* are used synonymously depending
/ on the context. This library consistently adopted the term *slave*.

defs.name: set_slave
defs.docs: Select a slave device for all subsequent outgoing requests.

attributes.value: / Select a slave device for all subsequent outgoing requests.

defs.name: ReadCoils
defs.docs:
A request to read multiple coils.
 The first parameter is the address of the first coil to read.
 The second parameter is the number of coils to read.

attributes.value: / A request to read multiple coils.
/ The first parameter is the address of the first coil to read.
/ The second parameter is the number of coils to read.

defs.name: ReadDiscreteInputs
defs.docs:
A request to read multiple discrete inputs
 The first parameter is the address of the first discrete input to read.
 The second parameter is the number of discrete inputs to read.

attributes.value: / A request to read multiple discrete inputs
/ The first parameter is the address of the first discrete input to read.
/ The second parameter is the number of discrete inputs to read.

defs.name: WriteSingleCoil
defs.docs:
A request to write a single coil.
 The first parameter is the address of the coil.
 The second parameter is the value to write to the coil.

attributes.value: / A request to write a single coil.
/ The first parameter is the address of the coil.
/ The second parameter is the value to write to the coil.

defs.name: WriteMultipleCoils
defs.docs:
A request to write multiple coils.
 The first parameter is the address of the first coil to write.
 The second parameter is the vector of values to write to the coils.

attributes.value: / A request to write multiple coils.
/ The first parameter is the address of the first coil to write.
/ The second parameter is the vector of values to write to the coils.

defs.name: ReadInputRegisters
defs.docs:
A request to read multiple input registers.
 The first parameter is the address of the first input register to read.
 The second parameter is the number of input registers to read.

attributes.value: / A request to read multiple input registers.
/ The first parameter is the address of the first input register to read.
/ The second parameter is the number of input registers to read.

defs.name: ReadHoldingRegisters
defs.docs:
A request to read multiple holding registers.
 The first parameter is the address of the first holding register to read.
 The second parameter is the number of holding registers to read.

attributes.value: / A request to read multiple holding registers.
/ The first parameter is the address of the first holding register to read.
/ The second parameter is the number of holding registers to read.

defs.name: WriteSingleRegister
defs.docs:
A request to write a single register.
 The first parameter is the address of the register to read.
 The second parameter is the value to write to the register.

attributes.value: / A request to write a single register.
/ The first parameter is the address of the register to read.
/ The second parameter is the value to write to the register.

defs.name: WriteMultipleRegisters
defs.docs:
A request to write to multiple registers.
 The first parameter is the address of the first register to write.
 The second parameter is the vector of values to write to the registers.

attributes.value: / A request to write to multiple registers.
/ The first parameter is the address of the first register to write.
/ The second parameter is the vector of values to write to the registers.

defs.name: ReadWriteMultipleRegisters
defs.docs:
A request to simultaneously read multiple registers and write multiple registers.
 The first parameter is the address of the first register to read.
 The second parameter is the number of registers to read.
 The third parameter is the address of the first register to write.
 The fourth parameter is the vector of values to write to the registers.

attributes.value: / A request to simultaneously read multiple registers and write multiple registers.
/ The first parameter is the address of the first register to read.
/ The second parameter is the number of registers to read.
/ The third parameter is the address of the first register to write.
/ The fourth parameter is the vector of values to write to the registers.

defs.name: Custom
defs.docs:
A raw Modbus request.
 The first parameter is the Modbus function code.
 The second parameter is the raw bytes of the request.

attributes.value: / The first parameter is the Modbus function code.
/ The second parameter is the raw bytes of the request.

defs.name: Disconnect
defs.docs:
A poison pill for stopping the client service and to release
 the underlying transport, e.g. for disconnecting from an
 exclusively used serial port.

attributes.value: / A poison pill for stopping the client service and to release
/ the underlying transport, e.g. for disconnecting from an
/ This is an ugly workaround, because `tokio-proto` does not
/ provide other means to gracefully shut down the `ClientService`.
/ Otherwise the bound transport is never freed as long as the
/ executor is active, even when dropping the Modbus client

defs.name: Request
defs.docs: A request represents a message from the client (master) to the server (slave).

attributes.value: / A request represents a message from the client (master) to the server (slave).

defs.name: ReadCoils
defs.docs:
Response to a ReadCoils request
 The parameter contains the coil values that have been read
 See also the note above regarding the vector length

attributes.value: / The parameter contains the coil values that have been read
/ See also the note above regarding the vector length

defs.docs:
Response to a WriteSingleCoil request
 The first parameter contains the address of the coil that has been written to
 The second parameter contains the value that has been written to the coil the given address

 The second parameter contains the amount of values that have been written

defs.docs:
Response to a WriteSingleRegister request

defs.name: Custom
defs.docs:
Response to a raw Modbus request
 The first parameter contains the returned Modbus function code
 The second parameter contains the bytes read following the function code

attributes.value: / Response to a raw Modbus request
/ The first parameter contains the returned Modbus function code
/ The second parameter contains the bytes read following the function code

defs.name: Response
defs.docs: The data of a successful request.

attributes.value: / The data of a successful request.
/ ReadCoils/ReadDiscreteInputs: The length of the result Vec is always a
/ multiple of 8. Only the values of the first bits/coils that have actually
/ been requested are defined. The value of the remaining bits depend on the
/ server implementation and those coils should be should be ignored.

defs.name: Exception
defs.value:
pub enum Exception {
    IllegalFunction = ,
    IllegalDataAddress = ,
    IllegalDataValue = ,
    ServerDeviceFailure = ,
    Acknowledge = ,
    ServerDeviceBusy = ,
    MemoryParityError = ,
    GatewayPathUnavailable = ,
    GatewayTargetDevice = ,
}
defs.docs: A server (slave) exception.

defs.name: ExceptionResponse
defs.docs: A server (slave) exception response.
